content: crochet bookworm bookmark by barbara svachak crochet bookworm bookmark by barbara svachak when i learned to crochet as a child i started to make bookmarks during my elementary school years i made a lot of these bookworms and used them to keep my place in hardy boys / nancy drew mysteries school books etc i hadn t thought about them in years but they came up during a conversation with friends during a covid zoom sip n stitch session - it is the first crochet item i remembered making i decided to make them again so i took a bunch of leftover scrap yarn and crocheted a few dozen bookworm bookmarks for the children s department of a local library people have asked about them so i decided to write up the pattern from my childhood use all types of colors and have fun skill level beginner - able to chain single_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch materials yarn 10 yards of worsted weight yarn per bookworm bookmark hook us h/5 0mm notions a tapestry needle to weave in ends locking stitch markers optional glue embellishments googly craft eyes gauge 16 double_crochet = 4 /10cm size worm body is 3 tail is 9 total of 12 copyright barbara svachak version 1 0 page 1 of 2 crochet bookworm bookmark by barbara svachak glossary us english terminology chain chain double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet sl slip_stitch pattern notes this pattern is written with worsted weight yarn you can use any yarn and comparably sized hook to make different sizes for example i find a g hook works well with dk weight yarn feel free to alter the length of the body/tail customize to your liking the googly eyes give the bookworms personality standard googly eyes are meant for older children that won t put the bookworms in their mouths or attempt to swallow the eyes the package of eyes i used said they are intended for children older than 3 please check your packaging if you plan to give the bookworms to a younger child that may attempt to swallow please use safety eyes or embroider them with contrasting to prevent a choking directions 1 chain 62 2 make 2 double_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook 3 3 double_crochet into the next 18 chains here s where the optional stitch marker may be used i usually count the chains and put the stitch marker into chain #18 i know that s where i ll put the last group of 3 double_crochet and not have to try to count the chains or completed stitches that make the worm body 4 2 double_crochet into the next chain 5 1 single_crochet into the next chain 6 1 sl into the next chain 7 cut yarn and weave in the end 8 trim the yarn at the end of the tail leaving 1/4 finishing completed crocheting the number of bookworm bookmarks you plan to make then add the eyes if you glue standard googly eyes let them
